summary: This document is a series of emails from whistleblower Christopher J. DiIorio to various legal and regulatory authorities, alleging widespread SEC corruption, obstruction, and facilitation of ongoing securities fraud. The author details connections between multiple individuals and entities involved in alleged money laundering, illegal naked short selling, and market manipulation, with a focus on Riot Blockchain, Virtu Financial, and various penny stock shells. The correspondence references prior whistleblower tips and accuses the SEC of protecting criminal enterprises.

persons.name: Christopher J. DiIorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, making extensive allegations of SEC corruption, market manipulation, and money laundering related to multiple companies including Riot Blockchain and Virtu Financial. He identifies himself as a whistleblower whose tips have been ignored or obstructed.

persons.name: Chad Everett Harris
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to the supervision of Whinstone's Texas data center build in 2020. Connected to Northern Data's acquisition and sale of Whinstone.

persons.name: Mathis Schultz
persons.role: Former Private Banker, Founder of Northern Data
persons.context: Founder of Northern Data in 2015. Mentioned in the context of the company's ownership structure.

persons.name: Dougie Cifu
persons.context: Repeatedly accused of knowingly lying about Virtu Financial's (NITE) equity market making share volumes to conceal illegal naked shorting and money laundering activities related to OTC markets.

persons.name: Barry Honig
persons.context: Described as a 'prolific Bag Man' involved in multiple alleged money laundering shells including Riot Blockchain (fka Aspen Bio, Venaxis, Bioptix), MGT Capital, and Inergetics. Central figure in alleged fraud networks.

persons.name: Mr. Gottschall
persons.context: SEC official accused of conducting a grossly inadequate investigation into Riot Blockchain, failing to visit its headquarters, and facilitating ongoing fraud by terminating the investigation.

persons.name: Joshua Sason
persons.context: Named in SEC actions based on DiIorio's information. Connected to NewLead, FreeSeas, and the Inergetics/Millenium Biotech shell. Allegedly part of fraud networks.

persons.name: John M. Fife
persons.context: Charged by the SEC for dealing in penny stocks without registration. Connected to Chicago Venture Partners and mentioned in relation to MGT Capital.

persons.name: Justin W. Keener
persons.context: Charged by the SEC for operating as an unregistered dealer through JMJ Financial. Action allegedly based on DiIorio's information.

persons.name: Mark B. Fisher
persons.role: President of MBF Clearing Corp and MBF Capital
persons.context: Mentioned in connection with a fraud 'acquisition' of a trading platform by Riot Blockchain, facilitated by law firm Sichenzia Ross. Based in New York but transaction listed as 'Miami'.

persons.name: Dmitry Akhanov
persons.context: Identified as an insider of Bioptix (later Riot Blockchain). Connected to the Russian state-owned Rusnano and a board member of NeoPhotonics. Raises national security concerns.

persons.name: Brian Colleran
persons.context: Healthcare executive who paid to resolve False Claims Act allegations. Became a large shareholder in Millennium Biotech (later Inergetics), a shell allegedly controlled by Barry Honig.

persons.name: Chad Readler
persons.role: Former DOJ Prosecutor, now Federal Judge
persons.context: Former DOJ prosecutor on the Brian Colleran civil case, later appointed as a federal judge by President Trump. Implied to be part of a corrupt network.

persons.name: Robert Eide
persons.context: CEO of Aegis Capital, a broker-dealer implicated in SEC and FINRA actions. His pension plan was a seller in a SciSparc (fka Therapix) offering.

persons.name: Kevin McKenna
persons.context: Named in SEC action for aiding and abetting Aegis Capital's violations.

persons.name: Eric Bustilloe
persons.context: Described as a 'grossly corrupt Piece of Shit' on par with Gottschall, implicated in the obstruction related to Mark B. Fisher's Miami-based dealings.

persons.name: Jeffrey McGonegal
persons.role: Chief Executive Officer of Riot Blockchain, Inc.
persons.context: Addressee of an SEC letter regarding a Riot Blockchain offering in December 2020, which proceeded after Gottschall's terminated investigation.

persons.name: Alex Kramm
persons.context: Analyst who questioned Virtu CEO Dougie Cifu on an earnings call. DiIorio challenges him to explain why Cifu was being 'less transparent' about share volumes.

persons.name: Dan Kamensky
persons.context: Individual whose sentencing by Judge Cote is called a 'gross miscarriage of justice,' allegedly set up by Handler/Ressler because he interfered with their Neiman Marcus deal.

persons.name: Jason Sunstein
persons.context: San Diego resident and CFO of several OTC Pink sheet companies (Viper Networks, Santeon Group, etc.), alleged to be involved in money laundering shells known to SEC LA officials.

persons.name: Ashraf Rofail
persons.role: CEO of Santeon Group/International Land Alliance
persons.context: CEO of Santeon Group and International Land Alliance (ILA), a company involved in Mexican real estate ventures funded by common stock, mentioned as part of alleged San Diego-based fraud network.

connections.description: Honig, through entities, allegedly used Bioptix as a vehicle to gain ownership in Riot Blockchain, which is characterized as a money laundering shell that 'pivoted' to crypto.
Both are prolific figures in alleged penny stock fraud networks. Sason is noted as a large holder in Inergetics, a shell allegedly controlled by Honig.
Alleged corrupt relationship where the SEC knowingly allows Cifu/Virtu to conceal true trading volumes and facilitates ongoing fraud by not investigating illegal naked shorting.
Whistleblower-tipster relationship that has broken down. DiIorio alleges the SEC has criminally obstructed his tips, denied him awards, and actively facilitated the frauds he reported.
Colleran, a healthcare fraud felon, became a large shareholder in Millennium Biotech, a shell allegedly controlled by Honig.
Akhanov, head of Rusnano USA (Russian state-owned), was an insider in Bioptix, the precursor to Riot Blockchain, raising national security concerns.
Law firm Sichenzia Ross facilitated a fraudulent 'acquisition' of a trading platform from Fisher's entities by Riot Blockchain.
Aegis, led by Robert Eide, was involved in SEC-approved offerings for Therapix (now SciSparc), an alleged Honig/Stetson money laundering shell.
Virtu acquired KCG/Knight in 2017. DiIorio alleges the core business of both has always been illegal naked shorting of OTC shells to facilitate money laundering.

events.title: Northern Data buys Whinstone
events.description: Northern Data/Northern Bitcoin purchased Whinstone, which was building a large data center in Rockdale, Texas.

events.title: Northern Data sells Whinstone
events.description: Northern Data sells the Whinstone Texas data center.

events.title: Virtu Financial Q1 2021 Earnings Call
events.description: CEO Dougie Cifu states April equity market making volumes were 'a hair under 10 billion shares per day,' a statement DiIorio alleges is a knowing lie to conceal massive illegal naked shorting volumes.

events.title: SEC Terminates Riot Blockchain Investigation
events.description: SEC official Mr. Gottschall ends the investigation into Riot Blockchain without recommending enforcement action. DiIorio alleges the investigation was grossly inadequate and never visited the company's claimed headquarters.

events.title: SEC Non-Review of Riot Offering
events.description: Following the terminated investigation, the SEC chooses not to review a Riot Blockchain offering, which DiIorio implies facilitated a subsequent pump-and-dump.

events.title: SEC Charges Joshua Sason et al.
events.description: SEC files charges against Joshua Sason and others in an elaborate microcap stock fraud. DiIorio claims this action was based on his information but was not posted for whistleblower award eligibility.

events.title: SEC Charges John M. Fife
events.description: SEC charges John M. Fife and companies he controls for acting as an unregistered securities dealer. DiIorio claims this action was based on his information.

events.title: SEC Charges Justin W. Keener
events.description: SEC charges Justin W. Keener (JMJ Financial) for operating as an unregistered penny stock dealer. DiIorio claims this action was based on his information.

keyFacts: The whistleblower, Christopher J. DiIorio, alleges the SEC is grossly corrupt and actively facilitates ongoing securities fraud, market manipulation, and money laundering while obstructing his whistleblower tips.

Riot Blockchain is alleged to be a front/money laundering shell originally controlled by Barry Honig and his associates, with ties to Russian state-owned entity Rusnano via insider Dmitry Akhanov, raising national security concerns.

Virtu Financial (NITE) is accused of being the core engine for illegal naked short selling of OTC penny stocks to facilitate money laundering, with CEO Dougie Cifu knowingly misleading investors about trading volumes.

Multiple SEC enforcement actions (against Joshua Sason, John Fife, Justin Keener) are claimed by DiIorio to be based on his information, yet were allegedly not posted for whistleblower award eligibility, indicating obstruction.

The document alleges a vast, interconnected network of individuals (Honig, Sason, Stetson, Fife, Fisher) and entities (Aegis Capital, Sichenzia Ross, Signature Bank) across finance, law, and regulation that perpetrate and protect alleged frauds.
